node.title: Øya 2013 – the best ever!
node.excerpt: Øya Festival 2013 is over. During four days in The Medieval Park and an enormous amount of club shows in the city centre, several thousand people enjoyed good music. The concerts were well attended by curious music lovers. Even the more unknown acts in the line-up, drew a good crowd. It has been a wonderful festival – from the […]

node.title: Øya 2013 is sold out
node.excerpt: For the twelfth year in a row Øya festival have sold out all kinds of tickets to The Medieval Park, in advance. We’re putting the final touches on the festival site and look forward to opening the gates on Wednesday. Now we look forward to a city full of packed club shows tomorrow, followed by […]

node.title: Wu-Tang Clan at Øya on Wednesday 7th of August 2013
node.excerpt: Wu-Tang Clan was recently reunited and comes to Øya with a big 20-year anniversary show.

node.title: Øya for the last time in The Medieval Park – We move the festival to Tøyenparken in 2014
node.excerpt: Next year we will bring the fantastic atmosphere and lots of great bands to Tøyenparken and surrounding areas, a short walk east of the city center. The process of finding a good festival area has been long and exciting, and we are very pleased to have chosen a place we believe is very well suited for Øya in the future.

node.title: Cat Power and Laura Mvula will play Øya
node.excerpt: CAT POWER (US) – Thursday 8th of August / LAURA MVULA (UK) – Wednesday 7th of August

node.title: Mathallen at the Oya Festival!
node.excerpt:
The Oya Festival is proud to present our new main sponsor: Mathallen Oslo.
During the festival our audience will not only get heaps of great music but also delicious food from Mathallen – Oslo´s new food court.

node.title: Supersilent featuring John Paul Jones at Øya Friday 9th of August
node.excerpt: The combined elemental force of one of the world’s most questing musical units and Led Zeppelin’s legendary multi-instrumentalist resonates deep over Oya Festival. The art of instant composition will be taken to new and beautifully realised places by a peerless group of musicians.

node.title: Godspeed You! Black Emperor and Beach House at Øya
node.excerpt: Goodspeed You! Black Emperor from Canada released 2012’s best instrumental rock album. We’ve been trying to book them for a long time, and finally they are confirmed for our festival.

node.title: Kendrick Lamar at Øya Thursday 8th of August
node.excerpt: Kendrick Lamar from Compton, California sold out Sentrum Scene in Oslo not long ago, and got raving reviews all over the board after a strong show. We’re proud to announce that he’ll be coming back to Oslo in August, to play at the festival.

node.title: Local Natives at Øya
node.excerpt: Local Natives from California are playing a sold out gig at John Dee tonight. On Thursday the 8th of August they will be back in Oslo to play at The Øya Festival.
